title: Who was Father Ernetti? Did he really invent a time machine? - Quora

response.answer_text: OK, So to answer first part of question,Wikipedia is always available. But here is a short intro though. Marcello Pellegrino Ernetti (October 13, 1925 – April 8, 1994) was an Italian Roman Catholic Benedictine monk. The book Father Ernetti's Chronovisor: The Creation and Disappearance of the World's First Time Machine, written in German in 1997 by Peter Krassa claims that Ernetti invented a device that allowed him to witness past events. Now coming to second part. After going through the information available it’s clear that he invented a device which could channelize the past events on a screen by detecting all the sights and sounds that humanity had made that still floated through space. What he made was a device like a TV screen which shows events of past whereas in my knowledge Time machines are devices that transport people from one time or space to another.However time travel is a concept still so far away from us but real question is, what about a device that just deals with images and sounds? Could a machine like Father Ernetti described be built? Well we actually use crude versions of chronovisors every day. A security camera hooked to a video recorder will enable us to see into the past. Even something as a simple as mirror is really a type of chronovisor. We don't see ourselves in the mirror as we currently are, but as we were just a few millionths of a second before (the time it takes the light to travel from our face to the mirror, reflect off and return to our eyes.) But could we capture something from past as far as WW I or back till age of dinosaurs.Well as of now we don’t have any device but maybe someday after studying and quantum physics someday we might be able to do that.
